channel.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
channel.description:
[center]What is [b]Multifarious[/b]? [b]Multifarious[/b] is a RuneScape Private Server that supports multiple RuneScape client protocols. I have written the Networking in Netty 4 Final and everything in this project has been written by me. At the moment, only the 637 protocol is added. I plan on having a 614 and 647 or 666 along with the 637 protocol to ensure a wide range of player entertainment.[/center]
[center][u]Latest Updates:[/u] [code]
Trading Multiple world support
[/code] [/center]
[center][u]So, just as any other person on here would track their progress[/u] [b] GREEN = Complete BLUE = Usable ORANGE = Being Worked On RED = Not Started[/b][/center]
[ul][li][u][b]Player Death[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Items kept on death[/li] [li]Players must die when they hit 0 hp[/li][/list]
[li][u][b]Grand Exchange[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]MySQL saving/loading[/li] [li]Selling/Buying[/li] [li]History[/li] [li]Collection boxes[/li] [li]Item sets[/li][list] [li]exchanging[/li] [li]combining[/li][/list][/list]
[li][u][b]Combat[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Melee combat[/li][list] [li]Special attack handling[/li][list] [li]All special attacks[/li][/list] [li]Tick switching[/li] [li]Magic combat[/li][list] [li]Skill spells[/li][list] [li]All skill spells[/li][/list] [li]Teleporting spells[/li][list] [li]All teleporting spells[/li][/list] [li]Combat spell handling[/li][list] [li]All combat spells[/li][/list] [li]Autocasting[/li] [li]Single casting[/li][/list] [li]Ranged combat[/li][list] [li]Special attack handling[/li][list] [li]All special attacks[/li][/list] [li]Attractor/Accumulator[/li] [li]Throwing weapons[/li] [li]Bows[/li][/list] [li]Weapon styles[/li][/list][/list]
[li][u][b]Equipment[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Equipment Viewer[/li] [li]Equiping/Unequiping[/li] [li]Degrading[/li][/list]
[li][u][b]Eating/Drinking[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Handling[/li] [li]Meats[/li] [li]Pies[/li] [li]Cakes[/li] [li]Potions[/li] [li]Beverages[/li][/list]
[li][u][b]Minigames[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Handling[/li] [li]Stealing Creation[/li] [li]Fist of Guthix[/li] [li]Sorceress' Garden[/li] [li]Clan Wars[/li] [li]Castle Wars[/li] [li]Bounty Hunter[/li] [li]Fight Pits[/li] [li]Fight Caves[/li] [li]Barrows[/li] [li]Duel Arena[/li] [li]Warrior's Guild[/li][/list]
[li][u][b]Skills[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Skill handling[/li] [li]Skill guide[/li] [li]Leveling up guide[/li] [li]Level targeting[/li] [li]Experience targeting[/li]
[li]Prayer[/li][list] [li]Regular prayers handling[/li][list] [li]All prayers[/li][/list] [li]Ancient curses handling[/li][list] [li]All curses[/li][/list][/list] [/list]
[li][u][b]Shops[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Buying/Selling[/li] [li]Free items buying/selling[/li][/list]
[li][u][b]Ground Items[/b][/u][/li][list] [li]Picking up[/li] [li]Dropping[/li] [li]Respawnables[/li] [li]Private[/li][/list][/ul]

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

So again, it’s technically different but what change will it have for players?

It’s pointless to do a lot of work behind the scenes if it has no impact on the gameplay/user experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Not sure what exactly causes the opcode variations, it could be the ISAAC cipher. You can see it demonstrated by looking at the send message packet across the 317 revision (opcode 253) and the 377 revision (opcode 63). These opcodes can be considered “shuffled” and I believe that sinisoul posted an array a while back mapping the shuffled opcodes to the real opcodes.

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

pretty sure i was asking a question…?
op code variations are based on Isaac and not revision so i don’t see what your point is?

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:15, topic:549462”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=668363.msg4470447#msg4470447 date=1422659800]
please for the sake of the amount of intelligence left on this site, stoo using the word protocol.

im not familiar with anything above 500, but from what i can see the only differences in 614-666 are things like loyalty program, clan camp/citiadels, quests, minigames, item enhancements, bug fixes, and of course a minor update to graphic and audio engine.

now with this in mind, i doubt there are many, if any at all, actual protocol changes/packet variables/op code differentiation. if there is, feel free to state them so the actual differences are known in the topic.

but for better clarification its different reisions, and not protocol changes.

also, how do you plan on implementing this service? you mentioned multiple revisions and worlds. such as one instance of the server is a dynamic access point which any of the many clients can connect to (similar to ryans server?) or one source which user can chose to run a specific world id / revision and then cross referenced with a single login server for your “grand exchange” and “communication” points?

if you plan to implement a similar service as ryans, how do you plan on going about nullchecks or are you going to implement all cache data on demand to all specifc clients from the server itself?
[/quote]

The variables for the packets and the opcodes of the packets seem to be shuffled as part of the obfuscation process.[/quote]
The packet values are changed because of the isaac cipher.

Vain_:

so the only main difference which will need to be implemented to allow for the different revisions is simply a map of each client revisions:opcode:handler ? no simple core

It isn’t that simple. You shouldn’t assume something is so easy you obviously haven’t done

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

so the only main difference which will need to be implemented to allow for the different revisions is simply a map of each client revisions:opcode:handler ? no simple core

Read full topic

@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:14, topic:549462”]please for the sake of the amount of intelligence left on this site, stoo using the word protocol.

im not familiar with anything above 500, but from what i can see the only differences in 614-666 are things like loyalty program, clan camp/citiadels, quests, minigames, item enhancements, bug fixes, and of course a minor update to graphic and audio engine.

now with this in mind, i doubt there are many, if any at all, actual protocol changes/packet variables/op code differentiation. if there is, feel free to state them so the actual differences are known in the topic.

but for better clarification its different reisions, and not protocol changes.

also, how do you plan on implementing this service? you mentioned multiple revisions and worlds. such as one instance of the server is a dynamic access point which any of the many clients can connect to (similar to ryans server?) or one source which user can chose to run a specific world id / revision and then cross referenced with a single login server for your “grand exchange” and “communication” points?

if you plan to implement a similar service as ryans, how do you plan on going about nullchecks or are you going to implement all cache data on demand to all specifc clients from the server itself?[/quote]

The variables for the packets and the opcodes of the packets seem to be shuffled as part of the obfuscation process.

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

please for the sake of the amount of intelligence left on this site, stoo using the word protocol.

im not familiar with anything above 500, but from what i can see the only differences in 614-666 are things like loyalty program, clan camp/citiadels, quests, minigames, item enhancements, bug fixes, and of course a minor update to graphic and audio engine.

now with this in mind, i doubt there are many, if any at all, actual protocol changes/packet variables/op code differentiation. if there is, feel free to state them so the actual differences are known in the topic.

but for better clarification its different reisions, and not protocol changes.

also, how do you plan on implementing this service? you mentioned multiple revisions and worlds. such as one instance of the server is a dynamic access point which any of the many clients can connect to (similar to ryans server?) or one source which user can chose to run a specific world id / revision and then cross referenced with a single login server for your “grand exchange” and “communication” points?

if you plan to implement a similar service as ryans, how do you plan on going about nullchecks or are you going to implement all cache data on demand to all specifc clients from the server itself?

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Sessy Pk3r, post:12, topic:549462”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=668363.msg4470350#msg4470350 date=1422636355]
RuneScape’s isaaccipher and their login RSA shit.
[/quote]
:palm:

I don’t think there were any graphical changes to items between the revisions you mentioned so limiting some items between revisions would be sorta useless. :|[/quote]
I’m not going to pack new items into the cache. How is that shit even relevant to the isaac cipher and RSA?

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

whattehp406:

Do you mean that you’ll have separate worlds per protocol then?

I’m saying that any protocol can have any amount of worlds and player’s can still message each other or buy items from the ge

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Do you mean that you’ll have separate worlds per protocol then?

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:8, topic:549462”]I understand that it would technically be different to program but what would change for the player, would a certain protocol be more efficient or faster.

And we can appreciate it but we’re a but dumbfounded by what usage this has so please elaborate on it.[/quote]
The usage:

[ul][li]Players can message other players no matter what protocol or world they are on[/li]
[li]All protocols can be handled through 1 server[/li]
[li]The Grand Exchange can transfer items between all protocols, but only items that are supported for that protocol[/li][/ul]

Every protocol is handled on a separate thread, so it’s not going to have much for speed issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

I understand that it would technically be different to program but what would change for the player, would a certain protocol be more efficient or faster.

And we can appreciate it but we’re a but dumbfounded by what usage this has so please elaborate on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

To everyone above…

The lowest protocol I would EVER add will be 503. I dislike the graphics and the little content of anything below. Also, no matter what protocol I add, it will always be different from the other because of RuneScape’s isaaccipher and their login RSA shit. So, the packets will change and the RSA values will change.

but ffs guys, appreciate the shit people try to do, aight?

RandQm:

Why is your project not on github?

Because I’m keeping it private

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

is there even a protocol changenin those revisions? fairly certain nothing major…

Read full topic

item.title: Multifarious - A Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

What exactly is the point of such a small revision range anyway, i suppose it would be interesting to have the option to choose the 317 or 600+ look or whatever but this seems pointless.

Will you be able to connect with every client of that range or will they be specific clients?

Read full topic

[center]What is Multifarious? Multifarious is a RuneScape Private Server that supports multiple RuneScape client protocols. I have written the Networking in Netty 4 Final and everything in this project has been written by me. At the moment, only the 637 protocol is added. I plan on having a 614 and 647 or 666 along with the 637 protocol to ensure a wide range of player entertainment.[/center]

[center]Latest Updates:


Trading
Multiple world support

[/center]

[center]So, just as any other person on here would track their progress

GREEN = Complete
BLUE = Usable
ORANGE = Being Worked On
RED = Not Started[/center]
